item.title: Disgraceful Abandoned Construction not done, 21st December
item.description:
Absolutely disgraceful construction just a abandoned for months and Greenwich council don't care You can see clearly it's half done It's actually very unsafe socially and when using the stairs one can slip and break their back easily Please do something Greenwich council

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pettman Crescent, Thamesmead

item.title: Uneven brick paving, 21st December
item.description:
The bricks used for the road-side pavement surface have become uneven. There's a danger of tripping into the road. I wonder why the council used bricks here and if it would be better (or maybe there's a plan) to replace them with paving slabs matching those alongside. Technically, once the paving subsides, this would mean fewer edges as trip hazards.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wilson Road, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter and leaves, 21st December
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1B, Chalk Pit Avenue, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter on Tabard street, 21st December
